title: Silver Price Crash: 3 Signs the Metal Could Be Headed for More Pain
desc: Silver prices crashed on Friday. One commodities expert says there are three signs to watch for to know if more pain is coming.

title: The doorstep revenge killing of an innocent mum that shattered a quiet community
desc: Joanne Penney only went to answer the door. It cost her her life. This is the story of a gangland shooting, a violent feud, and an innocent victim

title: These Gazans May Finally Get a Lifeline to the World
desc: Thousands of Palestinians are waiting to be evacuated for medical treatment as the border between Gaza and Egypt looks set to reopen in the coming days.

title: Auckland FC fall to Perth Glory after late goal
desc: Live updates of Auckland FC’s away trip to the Perth Glory. Auckland FC 2 Central Coast Mariners 2 Michael Woud won’t be in a hurry to watch this one back....

desc: The Milano-Cortina Winter Olympics open on Monday, but rapper Ghali’s inclusion draws criticism in his native Italy.

title: South Africa expels Israel’s top diplomat

title: Why Amazon Fresh Struggled to Break Through in Grocery: Store Workers
desc: As Amazon Fresh closes stores, workers say the chain struggled to resonate with customers and differentiate itself from Whole Foods

title: ESB issues flood warning for Newbridge and Clane as it may empty excess water from Poulaphouca reservoir
desc: ESB has said that it may need to allow some water to “pass through” from the Poulaphouca reservoir due to its “limited” storage, placing the towns of Clane and Newbridge under direct flood threat.

title: FACT CHECK: Is playing in natural outdoor environments good for kids’ immune systems?
desc: Playing in dirt and exposure to everyday environmental microbes helps train a child's immune system, potentially reducing the future risk of allergies and asthma. Experts confirm this 'hygiene hypothesis' but stress that balanced exposure is key, and basic hygiene practices remain essential for safety.

title: More than 200 killed after landslide hits miners extracting key smartphone mineral
desc: Heavy rain in the Democratic Republic of Congo leads to the collapse of mines used to extract coltan - used in phones, computers and aircraft engines.
